in accordance with established operational kpis. monitor alarms and events at scada and timely communication to maintenance teams for remedial action. support in fault data analysis and assessment of data from condition monitoring system. principal duties and responsbilities review start-up procedures, energization & de-energization sequence and standard operating procedures. participate in system start-up testing, performance testing and coordination with ghe for dispatch. perform safe and efficient operations inline with o&m manual, sops, oem recommendations while adhering to integrated control philosophy of nghp. monitor different alarms and events at scada and timely communication to maintenance teams for remedial action. report plant operational performance inline established kpis and maintain operating data / logbooks in accordance with operating procedures. ensure proper handover of the shift to reliver with details of all activities related to shift / ongoing. initiate changes in operating philosophy and procedures to ensure more safer and efficient operations. strictly follow the change management procedure and perform the roles as assigned under the procedure. prepare sequence-of-event for any abnormal / tripping conditions and submit inputs for root- cause-analysis. support in interpreting data from condition monitoring system and fault-data analytics, where possible. ensure strict compliance with environmental & social management system and communication to hse and operation management for any near-misses, incidents, accidents and non-conformance reporting. participate in classroom / on-job / refresher trainings. always ensure the proper use of ppe and other safety equipment, as provided in safety manual. ensure that ptw and loto procedure are implemented effectively. coordinate activities with other departments and staff as needed. perform other operational duties as assigned. essential education and/or qualifications required b.sc. degree in electrical engineering or diploma with 10 years of technical and managerial experience in the same field 3+ years’ experience in operation of utility-scale wind power plants with minimum size of 50 mw desired education and/or qualifications required b.sc. degree in electrical engineering 5+ years’ experience in operation of utility-scale wind power plants with minimum size of 50 mw skills / technical knowledge areas: good knowledge of scada operations of wind turbines, hv / mv substation equipment basic understanding and concept of maintenance activities of windfarm awareness of quality, occupational health & safety and environment management system principles knowledge of managing hse emergencies good decision making, analytical and technical skills good communication and proficient in microsoft office (word, excel, powerpoint) we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts name: Air Products
title: Environmental & Sustainability Lead
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible as part of a joint venture and one of three esteemed partners, air products is now actively recruiting talent for neom green hydrogen company's existing open vacancies! this is a unique opportunity to be part of a venture with industry leaders. are you searching for a dynamic workplace where innovation and collaboration thrive? look no further! in partnership with industry leaders, neom green hydrogen company is revolutionizing the energy sector with cutting-edge solutions. nghc is seeking motivated professionals ready to make a difference and contribute to a sustainable future. whether you're an engineer, operator, or technician or have expertise in various fields, there's a place for you in the nghc growing team. neom green hydrogen company (nghc), a joint venture supported by three prominent partners that collectively bring the technology, operational efficiency, and know-how of acwa power, air products, and neom in a joint-venture partnership with over 80 years of combined experience in the fields of hydrogen, energy, renewables, and global networks. their collaboration with nghc provides a unique platform to showcase the potential of green hydrogen and support the growth of the hydrogen economy. together, these three partners provide nghc with a solid foundation to accelerate the adoption of green hydrogen and contribute to saudi arabia's vision 2030. at nghc, you'll have the unique opportunity to work alongside industry leaders and play a significant role in the global energy transition. your work will have a direct impact on shaping the future of energy. don't miss out on this exciting and extraordinary journey with nghc. the time to act is now. apply now to be part of nghc team and contribute to a sustainable future. this position is accountable for the following responsibilities: ensuring the project is operating in accordance with the saudi arabian & neom environmental laws and regulations and all applicable neom green hydrogen company environmental policies & procedures. support the implementation of the nghc environmental management plan for during construction, commissioning and start-up phases. support the implementation of the nghc internal and external environmental audit plan, ensuring compliance to all applicable environmental regulations, lender requirements, contractual requirements and the esia. support the implementation of key nghc environmental policies, plans and procedures such as the ehs policy, e&s policy, biodiversity management plan, esms manual, chance find procedures, biodiversity action plans, cultural heritage management framework, biodiversity monitoring & evaluation plans, etc. provide technical assistance on specific environmental matters to all project scopes i.e., green hydrogen elements, power elements and hidc. responsible for ensuring all project-related environmental risks are recorded on the company risk register. review of contractor construction & social environmental management plans (and other related plans and procedures) and commented on as necessary. identifying sustainability risks and appropriate mitigation measures and highlighting any opportunities to increase the organisation’s sustainability credentials. support the implementation of the company esg policy through the development and implementation of quantitative and qualitative esg performance indicators. provide technical guidance to project teams during planning, design development, tendering and construction supervision to enable achievement of project sustainability and environmental goals and targets and project permits. monitoring of the contractor and subcontractor environmental records and esg monitoring data, where applicable. attend contractor 90 day lookahead hazids to identify potential environmental and sustainability risks and ensure appropriate mitigation measures are proactively implemented. ensure all project environmental deliverables are completed within given timeframes. company focal point during lender environmental & social audits, including the maintenance of action tracking register and coordination of contractor and subcontractor lender deliverables. develop an environmental legal register (permit & consent matrix) and establish a systematic oversight program to assure compliance with all applicable environmental laws. monitor the allocation of contractor and subcontractor resources to ensure that sufficient environmental resources are assigned to maintain compliance with all applicable environmental requirements. communicate improvement opportunities within the contractors and subcontractors execution of their respective construction environmental & social management plans (cesmp’s) and other related environmental plans, policies and procedures. ensures that contractor implements and maintains a waste management strategy aligned with project, lender and neom requirements. oversight of contractor environmental monitoring activities as defined within the respective esia’s and environmental permits oversight of contractor and subcontractor fauna and flora management develop and deliver environmental training as required. ensure protection of archaeological discoveries in accordance with ifc, world bank, company, esia, neom and other applicable requirements ensuring specific environmental risk assessments and method statements for all work activities are reviewed and commented on where necessary, prior to commencement of works. ensuring the project contractor and affected parties are directed in matters affecting emerging environmental risks. oversight of contractor and subcontractor water management, including groundwater and wastewater discharge monitoring contractor and subcontractor chemical management support incident / accident investigations in line with the established site procedures for same and ensuring accurate content and corrective action follow up. demonstrating a strong leadership commitment throughout the project active participation in ehs promotional campaigns, competitions, initiatives, established programs, etc. conducting environmental compliance inspections and audit for all nghc developments. aid environmental manager for preparing in monthly and quarterly environmental compliance report to lenders. develop and execute company sustainability initiatives and campaigns and track progress. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. at air products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. to learn more, visit about air products.

name: ISHADA Contracting

develop and maintain project schedules, including baseline schedules and periodic updates- coordinate with project team members to gather and analyze project progress data- identify potential schedule risks and develop mitigation plans- monitor and report on project progress and provide regular updates to project stakeholders- manage changes to project scope, schedule, and budget- ensure compliance with project schedules and deadlines- provide guidance and support to project team members regarding planning and scheduling activities- conduct regular project schedule reviews and identify areas for improvement- collaborate with other departments to ensure alignment of project schedules with overall business objectives- maintain accurate and up-to-date records of project schedules and related documentation- participate in project meetings and provide input on project planning and scheduling matters- train and mentor junior planning staff as needed requirements - bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field- minimum of 8 years of experience in project planning and scheduling, preferably in the construction industry, rsg project experience is a plus.- strong knowledge of project management principles, methods, and techniques- proficiency in using project management software, such as primavera p6 or microsoft project- excellent communication and interpersonal skills- ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines- strong analytical and problem-solving abilities- proven track record of successfully managing project schedules- experience working on projects in saudi arabia is preferred- fluent in english, arabic language skills are a plus. job type: full-time

name: Microsoft
title: Cloud Solution Architect - Data Security
description: with over 17,000 employees worldwide, the microsoft customer experience & success (ce&s) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of microsoft's end-to-end customer experience. come join ce&s and help us build a future where customers come to us not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, but also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience. we are looking for a highly motivated and passionate cloud solution architect (csa) for data security to drive our customer's data security transformation. this is a customer-facing role, owning the data security-focused technical relationship and strategy between the customer and microsoft through the whole adoption lifecycle, including planning, adoption, deployment and optimization. microsoft data security cloud solution architects are trusted advisors for customers attempting to secure their entire data estates against internal and external data risk. microsoft purview’s integrated data security services support customers holistically secure data: protect sensitive data using data classification, sensitivity labelling and encryption policies. manage insider risks using machine learning detection controls and indicators, adaptive protection to dynamically enforce controls and advanced privacy controls prevent data loss using built in exfiltration policies for microsoft 365 apps, services and endpoints. microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. as employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. responsibilities thought leadership - land an end-to-end value prop for microsoft data security. be a voice of customer to share insights and best practices, connect with global security teams at microsoft, engineering and product teams to remove blockers and influence the solution roadmap. trusted advisor - empower customers in their microsoft data security adoption journey, being hands on with them to envision and define a secure strategy, architecture, and implementation of necessary security controls aligned with m365 e5 and microsoft azure data security workloads while ensuring operational health. understand customer/partner technical environment - accelerate business value of overall data security adoption by improving security posture and ensuring that the solution exhibits "secure by design" framework, such as high-performance levels, security, scalability, maintainability, appropriate reusability, and reliability upon deployment. architecture design and deployment - run architectural design session to build a plan for implementing the solution — governing design in line with customer business goals and their technical environment. outcome is consensus on solution design and next steps toward production practice development - collaborate and orchestrate with other cloud solution architects and ms stakeholders including fasttrack, partner, and microsoft consulting in developing complex end-to-end enterprise solutions with the microsoft data security platform qualifications core qualifications: bachelor’s degree in information management,or related field and 5+ years’ experience in data / information management. 5+ years of working in cloud infrastructure, it consulting/support, systems administration, architecture and/or software development. good understanding of the principles of data security, such as data classification, encryption, sensitivity labelling, information protection policies and exfiltration controls experience in the implementation (end to end) of data security projects with data security platforms, preferably experience with microsoft purview (information protection, data loss prevention, information risk management) experience working with microsoft 365 services and/or azure data services such as sharepoint, teams, office 365, sql, azure data lake services. technical qualifications: ability to lead strategic customer conversations to educate and guide development of data security requirements. ability to lead strategic customer conversations to develop data security frameworks and solution architecture design. experience in content services recognised data security certification microsoft certification in one of more of the following: sc-400 microsoft information protection administrator programming experiences, using microsoft information protection sdk (e.g. c#, python) other technical certification in microsoft 365 and other cloud technologies (e.g., azure, amazon web services, google, security certifications). experience with public key infrastructure in terms of key management and hierarchy. additional or preferred qualifications: candidates should have broad experience in cybersecurity and expertise around related technologies and concepts such as zero trust, threat management, and extended detection & response (xdr), and identity. candidates should have knowledge as a security engineer or consultant to understand industry trends and competitive landscape, advise customers on ways to strengthen their data security posture or health, and land customer value through data security. architecture - ability to assess customer's multi-cloud data security and compliance ecosystem of systems & processes and make strategic recommendations that align with modern data security practices and principles. relationship building - proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior data security teams and executives in large or highly complex accounts. experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on data security solutions/projects. problem solving - ability to solve customer data security problems through cloud technologies collaboration and communication - acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills. presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (senior executives, security teams, data security admins, and cloud security teams). customer focus - customer obsessed leader with an "if i don't know how to get it done, i'll find someone who does" approach to solving customer challenges value realization - ability to understand customer business objectives and outcomes and ability to quickly leverage tech solutions to accomplish those outcomes trusted technical advisor - ability to build strong relationships with senior security stakeholders and quickly build credibility and be viewed as a trusted adviso microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. if you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

experience. ensure that all documentation is completed in sap correctly such as the log, outlining the fault, method of repair and the time, labour and materials used in order to support timely availability of information. monitor and support on the response to all emergency breakdowns to ensure plant availability, thereby minimizing downtime and possibility of liquidity damages. develop and promote a condition based preventive maintenance culture on day to day basis by conducting troubleshooting and root cause analyses, finding solutions to reduce reactive maintenance. support in activities related to budgeting, forecasting, accounting, work order management. troubleshooting and technical guidance troubleshoot critical problems/breakdowns of mechanical machinery and analyse mechanical machinery maintenance data and conduct site engineering studies to determine the feasibility of introducing modifications to increase reliability and efficiency of plant, thereby ensuring continuous improvement and operational excellence. lead the change management process through the identification and preparation of feasibility studies for new installations, replacements or repair of existing mechanical machinery including technical evaluation, specifications and materials for modifications in addition to process diagrams and cost estimates and ensure proper follow up reports and evaluation on completed modifications. provides field engineering oversight and direction for activities such as support, testing, installation, inspections, commissioning, etc. outage management/projects scope preparation for the major overhauls/lte/major refurbishments of plant equipment in close coordination with site team and procurement teams participate in the effective forecasting of manpower, budget and material requirements to ensure timely availability of resources and spares for effective execution of mechanical outage maintenance plans. oversight of the planning and execution of the shutdown maintenance of critical mechanical machinery, as per the recommendation of the oem, and provide technical support to ensure the ehs, scope, cost, and timeline objectives are met. documentation ensure availability of engineering documentation. keep proper records of documentation generated related to mechanical engineering activities (i.e. root cause analysis, troubleshooting support, performance analysis, integrity inspections, etc.). ensure that all maintenance documentation for the mechanical activities are completed correctly including the maintenance log, outlining the fault, method of repair and the time, labour and materials used to support timely availability of information. creation, ownership and management of the asset engineering risk register for the cluster in coordination with central engineering function and ros health, safety, security & environment ensure adherence to all relevant health, safety, security and environmental procedures, instructions and controls so that the safety of employees and environmental compliance can be guaranteed. together with hsse department, ensure that safety rules and regulations are fully explained to plant employees / contractor staff and appropriate safety and protective equipment is worn; safety notices are prominently displayed in all work areas and that all accidents and incidents are efficiently investigated and analysed whilst ensuring that measures are implemented to avoid any recurrence. adhere to all relevant health, safety, security and environmental procedures, instructions and controls so that the safety of employees and environmental compliance can be guaranteed. material management support in the preparation of regular requirements for machinery, spare parts and general materials for the mechanical unit within the plant to support timely availability of requirements as per maintenance plans and budget constraints. evaluate quotations provided by the procurement department to identify and provide recommendations on the most appropriate materials/machinery for the plant. relationship management develop and maintain effective business relationships with all relevant internal departments and external contractors with highest standards of business ethics, whilst promptly attending to all critical technical issues in-order to ensure the services required by the organization are delivered in the most effective manner. liaise with epc / oem contractors for clarification, analysis and technical guidance in order to ensure clarity of communications/accurate fulfilment of operational requirements. sap administration monitor and support in the effective administration of sap processes within the mechanical maintenance section and engineering section and adhere to sap guidelines in all related aspects of maintenance planning, scheduling, data management such as breakdowns review, corrective maintenance notification, creating maintenance work orders and planning in order to ensure data/system integrity in line with nomac’s defined standards. continuous improvement contribute in the identification and implementation of change initiatives, programmes and projects in line with the organisation’s standards, including leading the change management, process safety, ros programs etc across the assets work closely with the mpc team in the monitoring, follow up and improvement of actions identified by the monitoring and performance software’s deployed within the company act as part of a global processes, systems & procedures adhere to all relevant organizational and departmental policies, processes, standard operating procedures and instructions so that work is carried out to the required standard and in a consistent manner. skills practical experience and know-how of mechanical engineering. knowledge of downtime analysis and practical knowledge of problem-solving tools. knowledge of maintenance management methods, of predictive inspection tools and of cmms (computer maintenance management system, good knowledge of sap template desirable). project management. detailed understanding of preventative/predictive maintenance theory. knowledge of the operations of power generation plants. strong planning, organizing, and integration skills. teamwork and effective collaboration skills. education mechanical engineering

name: AtkinsRéalis
title: RISK Manager
description: join us in engineering a better future for our planet and its people. atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. we have a strong presence in the middle east that enables us to build deep and lasting relationships with our clients. we share their goals and long-term ambitions; we’re on the same journey to create places and infrastructure which will support long term sustainable development, healthy living and vibrant communities. we are seeking for a risk manager to be part of our project team based in dammam, saudi arabia. job description develop and monitor a risk issue and opportunity management process. develop and maintain a risk matrix identifying dependencies and the impacts of not meeting scheduled dates. identify, monitor and managing dependencies, and for resolving related issues. identify opportunities to arrange and co-ordinate any necessary discussions and agreements to realise benefits. monitor projects and ensure that an adequate and robust risk management process is under active management. implement risk management plan, risk log, and associated governance process. track significant risks to ensure that they are being systematically identified, recorded, evaluated, actively managed and regularly re-evaluated, and communicated across the program. identify, communicate, and manage inter-program or external risks. identify and manage internal program-related risks. review and update risk log against program status reports & meetings requirements qualifications with a minimum of 15 years experience in risk management; at least 5 years as risk manager in construction/engineering industry graduate in engineering / business or equivalent postgraduate qualifications or equivalent risk management qualification or equivalent would be preferred. essential criteria understanding and experience of complex projects strong leadership, communication, and management skills track record of risk management location this role will be based in the kingdom of saudi arabia responsibilities in addition, the client wishes to achieve the following objectives: provide accurate and timely management information on a regular basis on the status of various projects to monitor progress and drive delivery of individual projects, challenging and accelerating these where appropriate to enable management of risks and opportunities at the programme level to drive commonality and coherence between the various projects to ensure the interdependencies between various projects is understood and managed to ensure appropriate standards are set and adhered to legally and commercially to ensure the client is obtaining value for money through negotiations with suppliers develop the capacity of the client through the transfer of knowledge, skills and abilities o implement best practice program, project and other management and administrative processes benefits benefits are commensurate with working in kingdom of saudi arabia

name: KEO International Consultants
title: Lead Architect
description: overview: keo is a creative enterprise, where innovation is a way of life. we are uniquely resourced with end-to-end services to take clients from inspiration – through conceptualization – to realization of planning, design or project delivery in the built and natural environments. for over 60 years we’ve led with vision, contributing to many of the world’s most ambitious projects, iconic places, remarkable experiences and prosperous communities. as a highly integrated and agile aep/pmcm firm, keo is recognized by enr as one of the top 225 international design firms and one of the top 20 international pm/cm firms. we are also ranked by world architecture as the 57th largest global architecture firm and the #1 firm in the middle east region in their 2023 wa100 survey. we invite you to join us. why? when you join keo, you’ll discover more than just a job – you’ll find a supportive environment that fosters your professional development through internal global mobility and career development and does so within a culture that supports company-wide health and well-being through on-demand counselling services and regular workplace clinics. you will be invited to celebrate community events such as sports days, fun-runs, in-house sports teams and beach clean ups. in addition to your competitive package and benefits you will have access to a suite of policies that include hybrid working arrangements, individual athletic sponsorship, study assistance sponsorship, employee referral rewards, mentoring and coaching programs and extensive in-house on demand learning courses. responsibilities: our newest opportunity is for a talented lead architect to join our project management division based in al ula, ksa. this position is responsible for leading and overseeing the design process of the project. this entails providing clear guidance and direction to the team members to ensure the client's specifications, budget, and time-line are met along with ensuring accurate data is captured and reported relating to architectural tasks. we envisage success in this role to include: providing guidance and subject matter expertise to the project to achieve time, cost, quality and safety objectives. monitoring and reporting on the production of information with respect to the discipline-related services submittal progress. reviewing submitted shop drawings and material submittals (and the like) against the drawings and specifications, local codes and statutory requirements and international best practice. checking and ensuring co-ordination between discipline-related services works and all other disciplines. providing technical input and experience to resolve discipline-related engineering issues on the project. maintaining open communication with the client and contractor's discipline engineers on project related issues. coordinating the works to ensure successful project hand-over. attending technical and progress meetings with the contractor/client's representative. identifying issues and risks that need to be brought to the attention of senior project management as necessary. managing the qa/qc project requirement with the related discipline. preparing correspondence on subject matter expertise to issue to the client/contractor as required to meet project objectives. reviewing as built and o&m manuals for completeness. being the primary point of contact for project team manager and senior site personnel on project architectural related issues. maintaining an open dialogue with the relevant authorities. assisting quantity surveyor in the assessment of contractor’s claims for variation to contract assisting the planner in the assessment of contractor schedules and other planning matters (edt, procurement, production) researching, establishing and documenting the regulatory and code requirements related to the project. ensuring the orderly completion and timely assessment of project submittals and documentation reviewing cad drawings, renderings, layouts, study models, construction documents, and colour boards prepared by architectural designers. making new proposals and/or modify existing drawings when necessary. ensures compliance with applicable codes and standards as well as client requirements. writing construction specifications and prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials when needed. interfaces with suppliers as required. making sure that any activity offered for inspection has an approved shop drawing, method statement(ms)quality control procedure (qcp) and inspection and test plan (itp) and that the latest version of the applicable document is available at point of use. issuing non- conformance ( ncr) and follow up for closing after rectification prior to release inspection request (irf) approval . preparing punch list jointly with site engineer and sign off upon rectification. reviewing documents such as drawings , inspection and test plan (itp), quality control procedures (qcp) and method statement (ms) provided by contractors. qualifications: to be successful in this dynamic opportunity, we envision that your career journey to date will include 15 years work experience partnered with a bachelor's degree in architectural studies. leed highly regarded. member of riba and/or aia would also be of interest. keo’s performance is founded upon integrity, results, innovation, safety and our people. we embrace diversity and recognise its’ contribution to client success wherever we work. we are excited to hear how you can partner with our award-winning team and treat all expressions of interest confidentially.

name: ENGIE Solutions LLC
title: Data Center Electrical Technician
description: requisition id: 31506 location: riyadh, al riyadh, saudi arabia engie solutions middle east engie solutions is part of the engie group, a global reference in low-carbon energy and services, with more than 96,000 employees. at engie solutions, we believe in providing solutions, not just services. we bring to the table integrated, tailor-made, financed, technology-enabled, and data-driven facility management solutions that improve energy and asset performance for cities, communities, industries, and properties. the company is committed to investing in countries through empowering the local workforce, implementing smart technology solutions and know-how, and delivering financed and guaranteed energy-efficient projects for our customers. industry: facilities management job title: data center electrical technician position reports to: data center electrical engineer location: saudi arabia summary: the electrical technician ensures the smooth, efficient daily on going monitoring and planned maintenance activities to all electrical equipment that make up the data center environment by performing the timely and accurate completion of all the required work. perform all daily wos generated from cafm on time. primary functions and essential responsibilities: responsible for adhering to and implementing all facility guidelines and procedures related to his work. responsible for performing daily performance monitoring of electrical equipment during walk rounds. responsible for following sops and eops during preventive and corrective maintenance. responsible for executing work orders for minor preventive maintenance activities including non-invasive testing, infra-red (ir) analysis, inspections, lubrications, replacement of consumables, etc. responsible for escorting vendors at all times during major preventive maintenance and during reactive and corrective maintenance. responsible for checking that the maintenance is performed with respect to the method of procedures (mop) provided by the vendor. responsible for executing isolation, shut down, start-up, emergency shut-down and restoration procedures of all facility equipment whenever needed. responsible for responding to unplanned events and emergency scenarios, and for sustaining data center operations. responsible for escalating emergency failures and alarms to facility maintenance supervisor and vendors. report any detected malfunction or any required changes to the executed procedures in the work order once completed. responsible for requesting necessary tools and parts for work orders execution and for returning tools and replaced parts once the work is executed. responsible for maintaining tools in good conditions. responsible for proper disposal of spares and consumables as per implemented guideline. advise on any enhancement to be made to the current sops, eops, and mops through formal change request. responsible for executing any required change to the facility (set point, redundancy rotation, labelling….). education / certification / knowledge: diploma in electronics. limited knowledge about engineering principles, design parameters, codes, and standards. have a general understanding of electrical equipment in use in the data center (generator, ups & batteries….). have a general understanding of mechanical equipment in use in the data center (chiller, computer room air handler (crah), fcus, chilled water pumps….). very familiar with health & safety guidelines and procedures, especially for operating mechanical or energized equipment. experience: have minimum 7 years of relevant work experience in operating and maintaining data center electrical equipment. have experience in break fixing, dismantling and assembling parts and thus performing minor maintenance and workshop activities by hand such as changing bearings, windings, lubricating, replacing parts, testing, etc. have experience in equipment commissioning, startup/shutdown, loto (lockout-tagout) and isolation, as well as performance monitoring and alarm management. have experience in bms monitoring and alarm management from equipment control panel. skills/abilities: demonstrated skills in diagnosis, analysis and problem solving. ability to work a rotational on-call shift. ability to work under pressure, adaptable. ability to work in a team environment. ability to diagnose root cause of equipment failures. ability to communicate effectively with vendors who perform maintenance on the facility electrical equipment. business unit: gbu energy solutions division: esi amea - ksa legal entity: engie solutions llc contract type: permanent job type: full - time professional experience: skilled ( >3 experience <15 years) education level: technical college diploma

name: Vanderlande Industries
title: Process Engineer
description: job title process engineer job description function process engineer iii reports to operations manager direct reports job purpose statement analyse performance of system, processes, and scope as determined in the service contract. monitoring and analysing the performance of the system, possible bottlenecks anticipation and detection to avoid any possible disruption to the operations. increase the efficiency of the system, decrease down time, and maximize flow. qualification and abilities education level bachelor/master’s degree. preferred mechanical and controls knowledge to evaluate the performance of the system. experience with analysing way of working and process flows. process flow orientated. analytical capabilities. english proficiency with high level skills of verbal and written communication. experience minimum 5-year experience in similar working environment. responsibilities develop, maintain, and improve methods to gain and use relevant performance data. analyse system, process, and maintenance activities performance levels. evaluate and improve system, process, and maintenance activities work-flow. communicate performance status and improvement proposals internally within site base services management for client discussions and alignment. prepare reports for measuring the kpis and service levels as per the contract. responsible for monthly. name: Jadeer
title: Design Engineer (Oil & Gas Industry)
Soft Skills: ['time management', 'attention to detail', 'communication', 'focus', 'integrity', 'accuracy', 'innovation', 'collaboration', 'problem-solving', 'discipline', 'adaptability', 'analytical skills', 'communication skills', 'design', 'critical thinking', 'leadership', 'initiative']
description: are you an experienced design engineer looking to make a significant impact in the oil & gas industry? join our team and be a part of a global leader dedicated to innovation and excellence in engineering solutions. job overview as a design engineer in the oil & gas industry, you will leverage your expertise to develop and implement effective engineering designs and optimize systems, components, and processes related to natural gas extraction, transportation, and distribution. this role requires a strong understanding of engineering principles, industry standards, and regulatory requirements. key responsibilities develop and design natural gas systems and components, including pipelines, compressors, valves, and storage facilities. create detailed engineering drawings and specifications using cad software. ensure designs comply with industry standards, codes, and regulations. lead and manage design projects from concept to completion. coordinate with cross-functional teams, including project managers, construction teams, and regulatory bodies. prepare project schedules, budgets, and reports. conduct feasibility studies and risk assessments for new projects. perform technical calculations and simulations to ensure the integrity and safety of designs. analyze and troubleshoot design issues and recommend solutions. ensure all designs meet environmental and safety regulations. prepare and submit necessary documentation for regulatory approvals. stay updated on changes in regulations and standards in the natural gas industry. implement quality control measures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of designs. conduct inspections and tests on materials and components used in projects. collaborate with quality assurance teams to address any design-related issues. identify opportunities for improving design processes and methodologies. stay informed about advancements in technology and industry best practices. participate in training and development programs to enhance technical skills. qualifications and skills bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, chemical engineering, civil engineering, or a related discipline. minimum of 5+ years of experience in oil & gas, specifically in the areas of natural gas (ng), (lpg), or (cng). engineering master's degree is a plus. strong communication skills, capable of effectively interacting with clients and team members. excellent customer focus and a dedication to meeting the needs of stakeholders. proven time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines. demonstrated leadership abilities and a proactive approach to problem-solving. analytical skills to interpret complex data and make informed decisions. innovative thinking to develop new solutions and approaches to engineering challenges. critical thinking skills to evaluate project requirements and constraints rigorously. high reliability and adaptability in a dynamic working environment. attention to detail to ensure accuracy and precision in all engineering designs and documentation. strong collaboration skills to work effectively within diverse teams. initiative to independently drive projects forward with minimal supervision. working conditions working model: hybrid. flexible working hours. work location: riyadh, ksa if you are passionate about engineering in the oil & gas industry and looking for an opportunity to contribute to innovative projects with a global leader, we would love to hear from you!

job location middle-east/north africa, saudi arabia city madinah candidate criteria minimum level of education required 6-engineer’s degree minimum level of experience required 6-10 years

name: ENGIE Solutions LLC
title: Data Center Electrical Engineer
description: requisition id: 31454 location: riyadh, al riyadh, saudi arabia engie solutions middle east engie solutions is part of the engie group, a global reference in low-carbon energy and services, with more than 96,000 employees. at engie solutions, we believe in providing solutions, not just services. we bring to the table integrated, tailor-made, financed, technology-enabled, and data-driven facility management solutions that improve energy and asset performance for cities, communities, industries, and properties. the company is committed to investing in countries through empowering the local workforce, implementing smart technology solutions and know-how, and delivering financed and guaranteed energy-efficient projects for our customers. industry: facilities management job title: data center electrical engineer position reports to: data center facility manager location: saudi arabia summary: the electrical engineer performs daily on-going monitoring (bms) and planned maintenance activities to all electrical and mechanical infrastructure equipment that make up the data center environment. oversee that wos generated from cafm are performed on time. primary functions and essential responsibilities: responsible for adhering to and implementing all facility guidelines and procedures related to his/her work. responsible for developing all mops for all (minor) preventive maintenance activities according to vendors/oem operation manuals. responsible for following sops and eops during preventive and corrective maintenance. responsible for executing and filling work orders, verifying minor maintenance tasks performed by on site technicians, and witnessing major maintenance tasks performed by vendors. responsible for verifying isolation, shut down, start-up, emergency shut-down and restoration procedures of all data center facility infrastructure equipment whenever needed. responsible for performing daily walk rounds, monitoring building management system (bms), and for clearing all critical and minor alarms on both equipment control panel and bms workstation. responsible for conducting periodic testing on engine generators without load, and without utility. responsible for switching and managing rotating equipment and maintaining redundancy. responsible for responding to unplanned events and emergency scenarios, and for sustaining data center operations. responsible for escalating emergency failures and alarms to facility maintenance supervisor and vendors. responsible for maintaining tools calibrated and in good condition. responsible for managing spare parts and consumables inventories on site and keeping them up-to-date. report any required changes to the executed procedures in the work order once completed. advise on any enhancement to be made to the current sops, eops, and mops through formal change request. responsible for executing any required change to the facility (set point, redundancy rotation, labelling….). education / certification / knowledge: bachelor degree in electrical engineering. a very good understanding of electrical and mechanical systems in use in the data center including transformers, generators, switchgears, ups, pdu, chillers, computer room air handlers (crah), fcus, chilled water pumps, fuel system, etc. knowledge of engineering design calculations, principles, codes and standards for both mechanical and electrical disciplines. very familiar with health & safety guidelines and procedures, especially for operating electrical or energized workflows and processes assisting in the preparation and coordination of bim-related documentation, such as bim project execution plans, bim standards, and model delivery requirements participating in description: background sales consultants at minio collaborate with our field sales teams, including account executives (sas) focused on acquiring new logos and global account managers (gams) focused on serving existing customers. minio serves 77% of the fortune 100 companies, and we are determined to further expand our prestigious customer base throughout the middle east. your main responsibility in this role is to work closely with the sales teams to win deals with new logo prospects and also expand our offerings to existing customers. this includes targeting commercial, mid-market, and enterprise accounts through both inbound and outbound teams. the key to successful sales is demonstrating excellent customer empathy, conducting thorough discovery, and defining the value of our open-source-to-commercial license approach. in this role, you will collaborate with internal subject matter experts, sales and value engineers, and the field cto organization to understand customer business/technical challenges and develop unique minio solutions. as an sales consultant, you will work alongside minio's customer experience team to ensure that proof-of-concepts (poc's) are well-defined, and the results of poc's are clearly understood and actionable. what you will do we are looking for an experienced, driven, hard-working, methodical sales engineer who will be a key field team member to help drive minio’s overall customer new logo, arr and ndr results. you thrive on “jumping in” and creating repeatable, known best practices. as a founding go to market member, you will help us build scale process and scope to our approach working in the middle east, across motions and/or segments: minio value proposition expert: as an experienced technical sales consutant who understands infrastructure implications including database and storage with modern, ai-centric applications, you will become an expert in translating minio’s value proposition into the language and metrics of the customer to sell the outcome impact to business buyers as well as technical buyers. customer engagement: collaborate with the sales team to identify and qualify leads, understand customer requirements, and provide technical support throughout the sales process. conduct product demonstrations, presentations, and technical discussions with customers to showcase the value proposition of our solutions. address customer inquiries, concerns, and objections related to product functionality, performance, and integration. solution design: analyze customer needs and propose tailored solutions that align with their business objectives and technical requirements. work with internal teams (e.g. customer experience, field cto’s and product) to customize and configure solutions to meet customer specifications. provide technical guidance and recommendations to help customers optimize the use of our products/services. sales support: assist the sales team in preparing proposals, quotations, and technical documentation for customer presentations and contract negotiations. collaborate with marketing to develop technical content, case studies, and product collateral to support sales efforts. participate in trade shows, industry events, and customer meetings to promote our products/services and expand our customer base. relationship management: build and maintain strong relationships with customers, partners, and stakeholders to foster trust, loyalty, and long-term business partnerships. act as a trusted advisor to customers, providing ongoing technical support, training, and assistance post-sales. minio is seeking an experienced sales consultant to work in conjunction with our field sales teams, both new logo focused ae’s and customer focused global account managers. 77% of the fortune 100 run minio today and we are looking to continue to cultivate an enviable customer base. as a sales consultant, your focus will be to work synergistically with the sales teams to win new logo deals as well as existing customer expansion deals across commercial, mid-market and enterprise accounts across both inbound and outbound teams. the key sales motion is one of high customer empathy, discovery and value definition to lead the open-source-to-commercial license motion. this role will collaborate closely with internal subject matter experts, sales and value engineers and the field cto organization to translate customer business/technical challenges into business solutions uniquely solved by minio. as an sales consultant you will work in conjunction with minio’s customer experience team, who is accountable for conducting poc’s, to ensure poc’s are well defined and results are well understood and actionable. requirements experience that will help you be successful 10+ years of proven experience in sales consulting/sales engineering for global enterprises, having worked with a minimum of 3 firms for at least 2 years each. experience includes collaborating with account executives (ae) and/or global account managers (gam) to acquire new clients and develop new customer use cases. previous experience in early-stage start-ups within specific regions is a bonus. strong technical skills, with the ability to comprehend and communicate complex technical concepts effectively. capable of translating new application requirements into minio requirements. experience with data-intensive applications is required, including object storage, database, cloud-native, and ai applications. previous time in private and/or public cloud environments is preferred. working with or selling to technical leaders such as ctos or vps of architecture. prior storage experience, especially with s3 object storage, is a plus. excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. proven track record of achieving significant successes for previous firm(s). demonstrated ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. flourish when given responsibility and take extreme ownership. arabic speaking with excellent english is a must. willingness to travel as required for customer meetings, events, and sales support. bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or a related field (master's degree preferred). ***saudi valid iqama (work permit) is a must.***

name: AWS EMEA SARL (Saudi Arabia Branch) - H11
title: Technical Account Manager - Saudi Nationals
description: * experience in a similar role as a technical account manager, consultant, solutions architect, platform engineer, systems engineer, cloud architect etc. * understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for 2 or more of the following: compute, storage, networking, cdn, databases, devops, big data and analytics, security, applications development * internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences * ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment * customer obsessed * fluency in either one of the languages: english/arabic an aws technical account manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our enterprise support customers. as a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. you’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of aws services. you will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ aws environments operationally healthy. the close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from aws. our technical account managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. these range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. you’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project, and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues. aws sales, marketing, and global services (smgs) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. the aws global support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. aws support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of aws services. key job responsibilities you’ll build solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer ensure aws environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management consult with a range of partners from developers through to c-suite executives collaborate with aws solutions architects, business developers, professional services consultants, and sales account managers with a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from aws solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud uplift customer capabilities by running workshops and other enablement sessions. as we continue to rapidly expand in emea, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills. you’ll work with talented cloud technologists whilst expanding your knowledge of aws products. you’ll also have the chance to receive mentor-ship and gain aws certifications. do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? we would love to hear from you. about the team about aws diverse experiences aws values diverse experiences. even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. if your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying. why aws? amazon web services (aws) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. we pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. inclusive team culture here at aws, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. ongoing events and learning experiences, including our conversations on race and ethnicity (core) and amazecon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness. mentorship & career growth we’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become earth’s best employer. that’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional. work/life balance we value work-life harmony. achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. when we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. * professional experience with cloud offerings such as aws, azure, google cloud platform etc. * name: Gas Power Environment Health & Safety
title: EHS Portfolio Director
description: job description summary looking to make a global impact and solve problems? through relentless innovation and continuous collaboration with our customers, ge gas power, part of ge vernova, is providing more advanced, cleaner, and efficient power that people depend on today and building the energy technologies of the future. what impact you’ll make: the ehs portfolio director will implement and maintain gas power ehs strategy for new unit installations and projects in heavy duty gas turbine (hdgt) and aeroderivative business lines, including mega deal projects. in addition, this director will act as a player/coach and people leader to a team of ehs site managers and/or ehs projects specialists in the pole. the ehs portfolio director partners with the commercial team on ito preparedness and portfolio directors, project managers, site managers and technical installation managers to plan, implement and maintain the site ehs management system, ensuring compliance with all relevant statutory, regulatory, contractual and company requirements. this director will coordinate with the pole projects ehs director and site ehs professionals, as well as the project and construction & commissioning (c&c) directorship team to define, monitor and support resources to improve ehs performance at project sites. this director’s portfolio of projects may include kits, equipment only (eo), engineered equipment package (eep) and turnkey (tk). the portfolio currently covers all new unit projects in saudi arabia and bahrain; experience in these markets is required. job description what you’ll do: serve as people leader to a team of ehs site managers and/or ehs projects specialists in the pole, providing continuous support and mentoring. support ehs professionals aligned to projects including mega deals in the pole for ehs issues escalated beyond the site level. partner with all business lines (global supply chain, services, operation & maintenance) for both equipment schedule and logistics, and successful inclusion of and/or handover to services. work in close coordination with other original equipment manufacturers (oem), epc (engineering, procurement, construction) companies, developers/buyers (end customer) on successful execution of mega deal projects, for all type of projects. develop standardization opportunities and drive simplification of the kpi reporting and analysis process in the projects portfolio in the pole. plan and support the execution of site ehs plans for multiple projects/installations. work with site managers and technical installation managers to monitor the effectiveness of site-related rules defined in the site ehs plan and, in consultation with the site manager / lead ta, revise as necessary to keep up to date. consistently apply relevant ehs policies, procedures and minimum ehs standards per statutory, regulatory, contractual and ge requirements, ensuring effective implementation of ehs management system including policy, plan, training, effective risk assessment, inspection, auditing, event management and analysis. identify best practice opportunities and proactively implement. develop innovative solutions for onboarding of site teams for starting with the right safety mindset before site works, such as vr (virtual reality) for training on high-risk operations, training lab to experience risks before being exposed to them at site. ensure an effective review of ge and contractor method statements and associated risk assessment against ge, customer and regulatory requirements. actively communicate on the ge framework and audit requirements and ensure the site manager monitors and maintains site compliance. set up and maintain the ehs training needs analysis and training plan. maintain ehs records and documentation for the duration of projects. work with the pole projects ehs director, portfolio directors, pole construction & commissioning, technical direction installation (tdi) and individual project managers to coordinate planning and implementation of all ehs activities from ito to otr. ensure appropriate actions are taken in the event of an ehs non-compliance. establish and maintain project site ehs culture with lead ta, project manager and other supporting tas during mobilization and execution. liaise with ehs inquiry to order (ito) resources and project execution teams to ensure orderly and consistent planning and hand-off of ehs items to order to remittance (otr) and the mobilization of ehs resources to site. devote significant time to on-site support of projects, especially during the early phases of execution (premobilization, installation, commissioning and commercial operation date (cod)) and as needed during later phases of project execution. align ehs strategic objectives with customer. share ehs standards and lessons learned. provide ehs support and technical ehs advice to customer. establish readiness to work processes, including security and medical assessments. proactively identify potential customer deviations from ehs contractual terms, propose and implement mitigation plan, and escalate as needed. support pole projects ehs director in daily management of ehs key performance indicators for projects in portfolio. deliver timely information to pole projects ehs director and business management in relation to any trends that become evident through analysis of data from portfolio of projects. ensure effective ehs communication to all site personnel, including ehs read across events and actions. conduct quarterly audits at each site using comply works tool. record findings, document and communicate ehs performance. what you’ll bring (basic qualifications): experience leading a team experience working with both internal and external stakeholders within an organization ten years of ehs experience five years of construction safety experience in industrial sectors such as power generation, nuclear and oil & gas. bachelor’s degree ability to travel up to 50% (mostly within saudi arabia, however international travel is required as well) . applicants must be able to meet travel requirements, including ability to obtain required permits/visas in a timely manner permitting work in those countries/locations to which overseas travel is likely to form a significant part of the role as dictated by business needs. saudi arabia market experience is required english and arabic fluency. what will make you stand out: experience working with government representatives experience coaching, leading and motivating a team to achieve common business objectives experience simultaneously managing multiple projects and other responsibilities, adjusting to changing priorities and making decisions with speed and accuracy based on available information experience working with site and project management, including across multiple projects experience influencing a distributed workforce excellent written and verbal communication excellent interpersonal and influencing skills high say/do ratio demonstrates alignment with ge vernova's core values and leadership principles fostering a culture of integrity, innovation, focus and excellence; promoting a culture of collaboration, mutual support to achieve collective success. benefits available to you: ge employees rise to the challenge of building a world that works. in order to meet this mission, we provide varied, competitive benefits to help support our workforce: our culture | ge vernova (gecareers.com) our compensation & benefits are designed to help you manage your personal and family needs, while rewarding high performers. we offer a robust benefits package depending on your employment status and your national requirements. a healthy, balanced lifestyle can mean different things to different people. we've created programs that support the way you live and work today. ge invests to provide opportunities to grow your career by providing a path for continued on-the-job learning and development. inclusion & diversity: at ge, we believe in the value of your unique identity, background and experiences. we are committed to fostering an inclusive culture, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work because they feel accepted, respected and that they belong. click here to learn more: https://jobs.gecareers.com/vernova/global/en/i-d-e about ge gas power: ge gas power engineers cleaner, more accessible energy that people depend on, powering growth and prosperity for people everywhere. our leading technologies produce a third of the world’s electricity thanks to our talented people, who make gas work for our customers, stakeholders and the world. through relentless innovation and continuous partnership with our customers, we are building the energy technologies of the future and providing the cleaner, more efficient power people depend on today. additional information relocation assistance provided: no

assurance and compliance and establishing processes to address quality issues and enhance project outcomes identifying and leading continuous improvement initiatives with the pmo team technical
